intro: Scorzonera baldschuanica, commonly known as the Caucasian scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features a robust, tuberous root system that is often harvested for its edible qualities. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are alternate along the stem. Its flowers are yellow, with five petals, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Scorzonera baldschuanica is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in harsh climates.
